Class PokerHand

  • java.lang.Object
    • PokerHand

  • public class PokerHand
extends java.lang.Object
    The PokerHand class takes a String as a constructor in the form PlayerName: Card1, Card2, Card3, Card 4, Card 5 and determines the poker hand the player has. The checkHand method runs all the boolean 'is' methods to determine the current poker hand and sets the enum member hand to an enum Hand value and sets the high card and rank unless the hand is a Pair or Two Pair then they are determined in the calling class.
    Since:
    2018-5-13

    • Constructor Detail

      • PokerHand

        public PokerHand(java.lang.String input)
        PokerHand constructor takes a String as a constructor in the form PlayerName: Card1, Card2, Card3, Card4, Card5. It also sets the player name, fills a String array and int array for the name and values of each card, counts alike cards in the hand, and calls checkHand to determine the hand.
        Parameters:
        input - String constructor for 2 poker hands Example - Black: 2H 3H 4H 5C 9S White: 3C 8D 2D AC KS
